Package sammish93.tbage.models

Class RandomEncounters

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.models.Encounters
sammish93.tbage.models.RandomEncounters
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class RandomEncounters extends Encounters
A class that includes an encounter pool and an integer that states how many encounters are to be chosen from said encounter pool to be included in a single game's permutation.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static RandomEncounters create() throws InvalidValueException
      Returns:
      Returns an instantiated RandomEncounters object with a default number of encounters present in a single game's permutation as 10.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException

    • create

      public static RandomEncounters create(int nrOfEncounters) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      nrOfEncounters - Sets the number of encounters present in a single game's permutation to a positive integer value. NOTE: If the value is greater than the amount of Encounter objects in the pool then the amount of encounters in a single permutation will be equal to the amount of encounters in a pool.
      Returns:
      Returns an instantiated RandomEncounters object.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown if a value less than or equal to 0 is provided.

    • addEncounter

      public void addEncounter(Encounter encounter)
      Adds an Encounter to the pool with a default weighted probability chance of 50%.
      Parameters:
      encounter - An instantiated Encounter object.

    • addEncounter

      public void addEncounter(Encounter encounter, double probability) throws InvalidValueException
      Adds an Encounter to the pool.
      Parameters:
      encounter - An instantiated Encounter object.
      probability - A double representing a weighted probability chance of an encounter being selected to appear in a single permutation of a game. A value of 0.5 represents a 50% chance, whereas a value as 1 represents a 100% chance.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown if a value provided is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.

    • removeEncounter

      public void removeEncounter(String encounterName)
      Removes a single instantiated Encounter object from the encounter pool.
      Parameters:
      encounterName - A string representing an instantiated Encounter object.

    • removeEncounter

      public void removeEncounter(Encounter encounter)
      Removes a single instantiated Encounter object from the encounter pool.
      Parameters:
      encounter - An instantiated Encounter object.

    • getEncounterPool

      public LinkedHashMap<String,Encounter> getEncounterPool()
      Returns:
      Returns a LinkedHashMap of all Encounter objects currently in the encounter pool.

    • setEncounterPool

      public void setEncounterPool(LinkedHashMap<String,Encounter> encounterPool)
      Parameters:
      encounterPool - Sets an encounter pool to an existing LinkedHashMap containing encounters.

    • getEncounterProbabilities

      public LinkedHashMap<String,Double> getEncounterProbabilities()
      Returns:
      Returns a LinkedHashMap of strings representing an Encounter object, along with their weighted probabilities.

    • setEncounterProbabilities

      public void setEncounterProbabilities(LinkedHashMap<String,Double> encounterProbability)
      Parameters:
      encounterProbability - Sets all encounter probabilities in the pool to an existing LinkedHashMap containing strings representing Encounter objects, along with their weighted probabilities.

    • getEncounterProbability

      public Double getEncounterProbability(String encounterName)
      Parameters:
      encounterName - A string representing an instantiated Encounter object.
      Returns:
      Returns a positive decimal representing the weighted probability chance of an encounter being selected to appear in a single game's permutation.

    • getEncounterProbability

      public Double getEncounterProbability(Encounter encounter)
      Parameters:
      encounter - An instantiated Encounter object.
      Returns:
      Returns a positive decimal representing the weighted probability chance of an encounter being selected to appear in a single game's permutation.

    • setEncounterProbability

      public void setEncounterProbability(String encounterName, double probability) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      encounterName - A string representing an instantiated Encounter object.
      probability - A double representing a weighted probability chance of an encounter being selected to appear in a single permutation of a game. A value of 0.5 represents a 50% chance, whereas a value as 1 represents a 100% chance.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown if a value provided is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.

    • setEncounterProbability

      public void setEncounterProbability(Encounter encounter, double probability) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      encounter - An instantiated Encounter object.
      probability - A double representing a weighted probability chance of an encounter being selected to appear in a single permutation of a game. A value of 0.5 represents a 50% chance, whereas a value as 1 represents a 100% chance.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown if a value provided is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.

    • getNumberOfEncounters

      public int getNumberOfEncounters()
      Returns:
      Returns the number of encounters to be selected for a single game's permutation.

    • setNumberOfEncounters

      public void setNumberOfEncounters(int nrOfEncounters) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      nrOfEncounters - A positive integer to determine the amount of encounters to be selected for a single game's permutation
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown if a value is less than or equal to 0.

    • getEncounterOrder

      public Queue<String> getEncounterOrder()
      Returns:
      Returns a queue of strings representing instantiated Encounter objects. The queue models the order of traversal for a single game permutation.

    • getNextEncounter

      public Encounter getNextEncounter()
      Returns:
      Returns an instantiated Encounter object of the next encounter once the current encounter has been defeated.
